Gaza's students sit final exams amid bombs and famine
subhead: The Ministry of Education in Ramallah has set up an online exam for high school students in the coastal enclave. According to the United Nations, 97% of Gaza's schools have been destroyed or damaged by Israeli air strikes.

title: 'Israel's attack in Qatar may push Gulf states to reduce their dependence on the US'
subhead: With the September 9 attack in Qatar, Israel made it clear it no longer set any red lines when pursuing Hamas leaders, political scientist Ziad Majed explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: The women of the Clain family: A story of ordinary jihadism
subhead: Jennyfer Clain, a niece of the Clain brothers – the propagandists for the Islamic State group (IS) who claimed responsibility for the November 13, 2015 terror attacks in Paris – as well as Christine Allain and Mayalen Duhart all face accusations of having joined IS in Syria between 2014 and 2017.

title: Armand Duplantis breaks another record and claims a third world title
subhead: The Swedish athlete won his third world championship title on Monday in Tokyo, finishing ahead of his Greek rival, Emmanouil Karalis. In a flawless final, he drew on Karalis's challenge for motivation and went on to break the world record for the 14th time, clearing 6.30 meters.

title: 'French workers face not a Great Resignation, but a great disappointment'
subhead: Christine Erhel, an economist, and Bruno Palier, a research director at the French National Centre for Scientific Research, explain in an interview with Le Monde the growing rift between employees and employers, and propose solutions to improve the quality of working life.
byline: Interview by Alain Beuve-Méry and Pascal Riché

The Paris district where Parisians are priced out
subhead: In 50 years, the 8th arrondissement of the French capital, home to the Champs-Elysées and the 'Golden Triangle,' has lost nearly half its population. The mass acquisition of real estate by ultra-wealthy foreigners has driven locals out.
byline: By Véronique Chocron and Manon Romain

title: Sanctions against Russia spark rift between US and Europe over China
subhead: Before increasing pressure on Vladimir Putin, Donald Trump is demanding his European allies stop importing Russian oil and gas and raise tariffs on Chinese goods. The EU, which will present a 19th sanctions package against Russia on Monday, finds these demands unacceptable.
byline: By Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau), Philippe Ricard and Harold Thibault (Beijing (China) correspondent)

title: Putin's party prevails in Russian elections even without campaigning
subhead: Local elections were held across Russia on September 12 and 14. The campaign was particularly dull in Kostroma, a tourist town northeast of Moscow, revealing a society stifled by repression and overcome by apathy and weariness.
